definitions: having a yellowish-brown color like leather or light wood
having skin darkened by exposure to sun or artificial light
examples: She wore tan boots with her outfit
The desert landscape was mostly tan and beige
His tan face showed hours of outdoor work
After vacation, she had a deep tan

definitions: touching lightly or at a single point without intersecting
only slightly connected or relevant to the main subject matter
examples: The tangential force acted on the wheel's edge
The circles were tangential at exactly one point
His tangential remarks distracted from the main topic
The discussion took a tangential turn into personal stories

definitions: having a bright reddish-orange color like the citrus fruit
examples: She painted the sunset in tangerine and pink hues
The tangerine dress stood out at the party

definitions: perceptible by touch; having physical substance that can be felt
clear and definite; real enough to be measured or proven
examples: The sculpture provided tangible evidence of ancient art
Money represents tangible value you can hold
We need tangible results before the meeting
Her excitement was tangible in the room

definitions: twisted together in a confused mass that is hard to separate
involved in a complicated or confused state that is difficult to resolve
examples: Her tangled hair needed careful brushing
The fishing lines became tangled in the boat
The tangled plot made the movie hard to follow
Their tangled relationship caused many problems

definitions: having skin made darker by exposure to sun or artificial light
converted from animal hide to leather through chemical treatment
examples: His tanned arms showed his love of sailing
She looked tanned and healthy after the beach trip
The tanned leather jacket lasted for decades
Native Americans used tanned hides for clothing

definitions: arousing desire or interest while keeping satisfaction just out of reach
examples: The tantalizing aroma drew customers into the bakery
She offered tantalizing hints about the surprise

definitions: virtually the same as or equal to something in value, significance, or effect
examples: His silence was tantamount to an admission of guilt
The new policy is tantamount to censorship

definitions: fastened, sealed, or marked with adhesive tape or similar material
captured on audio or video recording equipment for later playback
examples: The taped boxes were ready for shipping
She taped the poster to her bedroom wall
The taped interview provided crucial evidence
All phone calls are taped for quality control

definitions: becoming progressively smaller or thinner toward one end
examples: The tapered candle fit perfectly in the holder
His tapered fingers showed artistic sensitivity

definitions: gradually decreasing in thickness or width toward one end
examples: The tapering tower rose elegantly into the sky
Her tapering waist emphasized the dress design

definitions: touched or struck lightly with a quick motion
made use of or gained access to a resource or supply
examples: The tapped surface produced a hollow sound
She tapped her fingers impatiently on the desk
The tapped phone line revealed criminal activity
They tapped new markets for their products

definitions: delayed beyond the expected, proper, or usual time
examples: The tardy student missed the morning announcements
Her tardy arrival disrupted the entire meeting

definitions: having a sharp, acidic taste that makes the mouth pucker
using sharp or bitter words; having a biting quality in speech
examples: The tart apples were perfect for pie making
She enjoyed tart candies more than sweet ones
Her tart reply silenced his complaints immediately
The critic's tart review stung the playwright

definitions: showing good aesthetic judgment or appropriate behavior in social situations
examples: The tasteful decorations enhanced the room's elegance
She wore a tasteful black dress to the funeral

definitions: having little or no flavor when eaten or drunk
showing poor aesthetic judgment or social inappropriateness
examples: The tasteless hospital food needed salt and pepper
The overcooked vegetables were bland and tasteless
His tasteless jokes offended everyone at dinner
The tasteless decorations clashed with the elegant venue

definitions: having a pleasant, appealing flavor when eaten
examples: The tasty meal satisfied all the dinner guests
She prepared tasty snacks for the children's party

definitions: old and torn; hanging in rags from wear or damage
examples: His tattered coat showed years of hard use
The tattered flag still flew above the fort

definitions: intended to provoke or challenge in a mocking, insulting way
examples: His taunting remarks started the playground fight
The crowd's taunting chants upset the visiting team

definitions: stretched or pulled tight; not slack or loose
showing mental or emotional strain; tense and controlled
examples: The taut rope could support the climber's weight
Keep the sail taut to catch more wind
Her taut expression revealed her inner anxiety
The taut atmosphere made everyone uncomfortable

definitions: having a warm sandy or orange-brown color like a lion
examples: The lion's tawny mane gleamed in the sunlight
She admired the owl's tawny feathers

definitions: legally required to have tax paid on it by law
examples: Most taxable income must be reported annually
The taxable value of the property increased significantly

definitions: requiring great physical or mental effort that causes fatigue
examples: The taxing workout left everyone exhausted
Caring for elderly parents can be emotionally taxing

definitions: having a dark greenish-blue color like the duck's head marking
examples: The teal curtains matched the ocean view perfectly
She chose teal paint for the bathroom walls

definitions: shedding tears or about to cry from emotion
examples: The tearful reunion moved everyone watching
She gave a tearful goodbye at the airport

definitions: pulling apart or into pieces with force
moving with violent speed or urgency
examples: The tearing sound meant the fabric was ruined
Tearing paper can be surprisingly therapeutic
The car went tearing down the empty highway
He came tearing around the corner

definitions: subjected to playful mockery or good-natured joking
having hair combed backward to create volume and height
examples: The teased child laughed at the gentle jokes
He felt teased but knew they meant no harm
Her teased hair was typical of 1980s fashion
The teased bangs added dramatic height

definitions: making fun of someone in a playful, good-natured way
examples: His teasing manner showed affection for his sister
The teasing comments were all in good fun

definitions: relating to the structure of earth's crust and large-scale processes affecting it
examples: Tectonic plates shift causing earthquakes
The tectonic forces shaped the mountain range

definitions: too long, slow, or dull; tiresome because of length or monotony
examples: The tedious lecture seemed to last forever
Filing paperwork is a tedious but necessary task

definitions: filled with an abundance of something, especially living things
examples: The teeming marketplace buzzed with activity
The pond was teeming with fish and frogs

definitions: being in the age range from thirteen to nineteen years old
examples: The teenaged students organized a charity drive
Her teenaged daughter was learning to drive

definitions: using minimal words like an old telegraph message to save cost
examples: His telegraphic email style saved time but lacked warmth
The telegraphic note simply said 'arrived safely'

definitions: able to communicate thoughts directly from mind to mind without speech
examples: The twins seemed to have a telepathic connection
She wished for telepathic powers during the test

definitions: relating to or using a telescope for seeing distant objects
able to slide into itself to become shorter like telescope sections
examples: The telescopic lens captured distant galaxies
Telescopic observations revealed new planets
The telescopic antenna extended from the radio
His telescopic walking stick fit in his bag

definitions: showing or revealing significant information often unintentionally
examples: Her telling glance revealed her true feelings
The telling details exposed the truth

definitions: revealing information that was meant to be hidden or secret
examples: The telltale signs of wear showed the item's age
His telltale blush revealed his embarrassment

definitions: liable to unreasonable changes of mood; difficult to predict or rely on
examples: The temperamental artist refused to perform
Her temperamental car often wouldn't start

definitions: having mild temperatures without extremes of hot or cold
showing moderation or self-restraint in behavior and habits
examples: The temperate climate made farming year-round possible
Temperate regions rarely experience severe weather
His temperate response calmed the heated argument
She maintained temperate habits throughout her life

definitions: made less severe or extreme through modifying influence
treated with a process of heating and cooling to achieve desired hardness
examples: His tempered enthusiasm was more realistic
The criticism was tempered with praise
The tempered steel blade held its edge well
Tempered glass is safer when it breaks

definitions: acting to make something less harsh, severe, or extreme
examples: The tempering influence of age made him wiser
Her tempering words eased the tension

definitions: very stormy; showing violent and uncontrolled emotion or behavior
examples: Their tempestuous relationship ended in dramatic fashion
The tempestuous seas threatened the small boat

definitions: relating to time as opposed to eternity or space
relating to worldly affairs rather than spiritual matters
examples: The temporal sequence of events was crucial
Scientists studied temporal changes in climate
He focused on temporal concerns over spiritual ones
The king held temporal power over his subjects

definitions: appealing to or attracting someone even if wrong or unwise
examples: The tempting dessert menu made dieting difficult
It was tempting to skip work on such a beautiful day

definitions: being one more than nine in number
examples: She bought ten apples at the market
The committee has ten members

definitions: holding fast; characterized by keeping firm hold of something physically or mentally
examples: Her tenacious pursuit of justice inspired others
The tenacious vine clung to the wall

definitions: occupied by a tenant or tenants who pay rent
examples: The fully tenanted building generated steady income
All tenanted apartments required monthly inspections

definitions: regularly or frequently behaving in a particular way; having tendency
examples: Students tending toward science chose advanced classes
The weather is tending toward rain

definitions: being ten times as great or as many in number
examples: The investment grew tenfold in just five years
Her efforts produced tenfold results

definitions: having the highest natural adult male singing voice
examples: The tenor singer led the choir performance
His tenor voice carried over the orchestra
